dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Did a billionaire really just overpay by 15 million dollars for a Trump property in Beverly Hills?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Did a billionaire really just overpay by fifteen million dollars for a Trump property in Beverly Hills?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The truth is, no one did. The reported $13.5 million price was squarely within the range of what could be expected for the house.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, uh, Hary Tanoesoedibjo, that Indonesian businessman, reportedly paid 25 million for the mansion on North Canon Drive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, uh, Hary Tanoesoedibjo, that Indonesian businessman, reportedly paid twenty five million for the mansion on North Canon Drive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The reported $13.5 million price was squarely within the range of what could be expected for the house.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is just valued at, what, 10 million by Forbes in February? That's a massive markup.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is just valued at, what, ten million by Forbes in February? That's a massive markup.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In February, Forbes valued the property at $13 million as part of its twice-annual look at the size of Donald Trumps fortune.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and local brokers said it was worth maybe 8 to 11 million tops. Joe Babajian from Rodeo Realty called 25 million "outrageous."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and local brokers said it was worth maybe eight to eleven million tops. Joe Babajian from Rodeo Realty called twenty five million outrageous.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even the broker who offered the lowest estimate, Joe Babajian of Rodeo Realty, said that $13.5 million was not an outrageous amount of money: Its definitely in the range.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not like this place was flying off the market either—Mitra Sisatar from Sotheby's said it couldn't even sell a year ago.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not like this place was flying off the market either-Mitra Sisatar from Sotheby's said it couldn't even sell a year ago.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Friday, Forbes interviewed a sixth broker, Mitra Sisatar of Coldwell Banker. She said one of her colleagues tried to sell Trumps house a few months ago.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So why would someone pay more than double the market value? Tucker Carlson's segment really dug into that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So why would someone pay more than double the market value? Tucker Carlson's segment really dug into that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's hard not to see it as, like, paying for proximity to power, you know? The cachet of buying from a former president.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's hard not to see it as, like, paying for proximity to power, you know? The cachet of buying from a former president.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While its hard to get inside the head of any real estate buyer, Babajian said some people might be attracted to the cachet of buying a property from the president of the United States.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Ernie Carswell, another broker, straight up said it sold at a premium because the seller was Trump.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Ernie Carswell, another broker, straight up said it sold at a premium because the seller was Trump.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Another local broker, Ernie Carswell, agreed: I believe it sold at the slight premium simply because of who the seller was.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And there's the ethics angle—Tanoesoedibjo is a business rival with political ambitions. Feels sketchy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And there's the ethics angle-Tanoesoedibjo is a business rival with political ambitions. Feels sketchy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tanoesoedibjo is an Indonesian business partner of Donald Trump, with his own ambitions for political office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, Trump's lawyer promised no new foreign deals during his presidency. This seems to violate that pledge, big time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, Trump's lawyer promised no new foreign deals during his presidency. This seems to violate that pledge, big time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shortly before Trumps inauguration, his lawyer promised no new foreign deals will be made whatsoever during the duration of President Trumps presidency. If Tanoesoedibjo is in fact the buyer, the recent sale would seem to violate Trumps pledge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Not his first time, though. He's had deals with state-owned banks from Russia and China before.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not his first time, though. He's had deals with state-owned banks from Russia and China before.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The president has counted state-owned banks from China and India as tenants in two of his buildings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So it's not just a weird real estate story—it's about influence, image, and maybe dodging ethics rules.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's not just a weird real estate story-it's about influence, image, and maybe dodging ethics rules.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And conveniently, it boosts Trump's net worth by 20 million on paper if he pays taxes on that gain.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And conveniently, it boosts Trump's net worth by twenty million on paper if he pays taxes on that gain.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If President Trump pays taxes on his apparent $6.5 million gain, his recent transaction could actually knock down his estimated net worth rather than boost it.

artist_script:
HostA: Did a billionaire really just overpay by 15 million dollars for a Trump property in Beverly Hills?
HostB: Yeah, uh, Hary Tanoesoedibjo, that Indonesian businessman, reportedly paid 25 million for the mansion on North Canon Drive.
HostA: Which is just valued at, what, 10 million by Forbes in February? That’s a massive markup.
HostB: Right, and local brokers said it was worth maybe 8 to 11 million tops. Joe Babajian from Rodeo Realty called 25 million "outrageous."
HostA: And it’s not like this place was flying off the market either—Mitra Sisatar from Sotheby’s said it couldn’t even sell a year ago.
HostB: So why would someone pay more than double the market value? Tucker Carlson’s segment really dug into that.
HostA: It’s hard not to see it as, like, paying for proximity to power, you know? The cachet of buying from a former president.
HostB: Exactly. Ernie Carswell, another broker, straight up said it sold at a premium because the seller was Trump.
HostA: And there’s the ethics angle—Tanoesoedibjo is a business rival with political ambitions. Feels sketchy.
HostB: Plus, Trump’s lawyer promised no new foreign deals during his presidency. This seems to violate that pledge, big time.
HostA: Not his first time, though. He’s had deals with state-owned banks from Russia and China before.
HostB: So it’s not just a weird real estate story—it’s about influence, image, and maybe dodging ethics rules.
HostA: And conveniently, it boosts Trump’s net worth by 20 million on paper if he pays taxes on that gain.
HostB: Wild. Just wild.
